Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which Scott Walker cut taxes for the wealthiest individuals.
Understate: The claim may understate the extent to which Scott Walker cut income taxes across every income bracket.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support to conclusively prove that Scott Walker raised taxes on 140,000 Wisconsin families.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make a problematic assumption that the reduction in income tax rates would not sufficiently offset the loss of the state Earned Income Tax Credit for the 140,000 families.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the tax changes enacted by Scott Walker, such as the intention to benefit a broad cross-section of taxpayers.
